Uses of Class
spoon.FluentLauncher

  • Packages that use FluentLauncher 
    Package Description
    spoon
    This root package provides the default integrated launchers for Spoon program processing.

    • Uses of FluentLauncher in spoon

      Methods in spoon that return FluentLauncher 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FluentLauncher FluentLauncher.autoImports(boolean autoImports)
      Tell to the Java printer to automatically generate imports and use simple names instead of fully-qualified name.
      FluentLauncher FluentLauncher.complianceLevel(int level)
      Sets the Java version compliance level.
      FluentLauncher FluentLauncher.disableConsistencyChecks()
      Disable all consistency checks on the AST.
      FluentLauncher FluentLauncher.encoding(java.nio.charset.Charset encoding)
      Set the encoding to use for parsing source code
      FluentLauncher FluentLauncher.inputResource(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> paths)
      Adds an input resource to be processed by Spoon (either a file or a folder).
      FluentLauncher FluentLauncher.inputResource(java.lang.String path)
      Adds an input resource to be processed by Spoon (either a file or a folder).
      FluentLauncher FluentLauncher.noClasspath(boolean option)
      Sets the option "noclasspath", use with caution (see explanation below).
      FluentLauncher FluentLauncher.outputDirectory(java.io.File outputDirectory)
      Sets the output directory for source generated.
      FluentLauncher FluentLauncher.outputDirectory(java.lang.String path)
      Sets the output directory for source generated.
